name: The Werner Projection
author: mla
description: The Werner projection, described by Johannes Werner in the early 16th century, after Stabius and also Ptolemy. Projection is equal area and with correct distances along central meridian and the concentric lines of latitude. Mousable.
buffer_a_code:
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//
// 16 color GIF, cropped, run length encoded and packed into an array of uvec4s
// Upper 4 bits of each byte is the runlength-1 (we don't need 0 length runs,
// obviously), lower 4 bits is the color index.
//
// Original image by NASA.
//
// Does basic coloring here rather than in Image tab to get the benefit
// of texture filtering.
//
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

const uvec4 data[] = uvec4[](
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u),
uvec4(0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf0f0f0f0u,0xf07110f0u,0x023120f0u),
uvec4(0x13010211u,0x45360514u,0xf0110334u,0xf0f0f0f0u),

const int WIDTH = 512;
const int HEIGHT = 256;

const vec3 colors[] = vec3[](
vec3(0x10,0x10,0x30),
vec3(0x30,0x30,0x40),
vec3(0x70,0x60,0x60),
vec3(0x70,0x80,0x80),
vec3(0xa0,0xa0,0xa0),
vec3(0xd0,0xc0,0xa0),
vec3(0xe0,0xe0,0xe0),
vec3(0xb0,0x90,0x70),
vec3(0x90,0x70,0x50),
vec3(0x20,0x30,0x20),
vec3(0x30,0x50,0x30),
vec3(0x50,0x50,0x30),
vec3(0xe0,0xd0,0xb0),
vec3(0x30,0x40,0x10),
vec3(0x30,0x50,0x10));

vec3 getcolor(int i) {
  return colors[i%colors.length()]/255.0;
}

void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor, vec2 fragCoord) {
  fragColor = texelFetch(iChannel0,ivec2(fragCoord),0);
  float ires = iResolution.x*10000.0 + iResolution.y;
  if (fragColor.w == ires) return; // Check for resize
  fragColor.w = ires;
  // wraparound at edges to avoid mipmap discontinuities
  int row = int(fragCoord.y)%HEIGHT;
  int col = int(fragCoord.x)%WIDTH;
  //if (row >= HEIGHT || col >= WIDTH) return;
  int rstart = lines[row];
  int rend = lines[row+1];
  int c = -1;
  int colcount = 0;
  for (int index = rstart; index < rend; index++) {
    int i = index;
    uvec4 entry = data[i/16];
    i %= 16;
    uint t = entry[i/4];
    i %= 4;
    t >>= 8*i;
    int count = (int(t >> 4)&15)+1;
    colcount += count;
    if (col < colcount) {
      c = int(t)&15;
      break;
    }
  }
  if (c >= 0) fragColor.rgb = getcolor(c);
}

name: RLE Earth
author: mla
description: The Earth, 512x256, run length encoded from a 16-color GIF. Original image by NASA.

// 16 color GIF, cropped, run length encoded and packed into an array of uvec4s
// Upper 4 bits of each byte is the runlength-1 (we don't need 0 length runs,
// obviously), lower 4 bits is the color index.
//
// Original image by NASA.
//
// Does basic coloring here rather than in Image tab to get the benefit
// of texture filtering.
//

// RLE data is divided into rows.
// Index of start pixel for each row is stored here.
const int rowindex[] = int[](
0,32,64,96,128,160,192,224,256,288,334,385,461,539,623,718,805,895,982,1077,1185,1291,1376,1450,1544,1643,1754,1869,1984,2118,2267,2422,2594,2725,2880,3019,3150,3276,3383,3512,3641,3766,3877,3986,4082,4190,4303,4412,4505,4604,4692,4780,4889,4990,5086,5188,5296,5395,5501,5609,5712,5819,5945,6075,6204,6339,6469,6596,6728,6843,6981,7098,7223,7352,7474,7615,7767,7882,7997,8113,8220,8327,8435,8527,8654,8758,8869,8977,9085,9202,9316,9435,9557,9665,9770,9866,9961,10060,10161,10245,10337,10413,10492,10571,10651,10725,10807,10884,10970,11047,11128,11217,11314,11403,11497,11591,11676,11754,11820,11894,11965,12036,12107,12175,12250,12325,12388,12457,12525,12594,12662,12746,12821,12905,12979,13053,13124,13200,13271,13338,13405,13483,13557,13629,13697,13773,13845,13924,14000,14079,14150,14220,14305,14388,14465,14532,14599,14673,14747,14814,14892,14969,15038,15108,15172,15243,15323,15395,15470,15546,15623,15693,15760,15829,15895,15965,16035,16098,16158,16212,16264,16315,16364,16414,16458,16502,16545,16592,16637,16686,16727,16771,16815,16856,16900,16940,16979,17022,17068,17112,17154,17194,17236,17275,17316,17356,17398,17434,17466,17498,17530,17564,17598,17632,17664,17696,17728,17762,17797,17832,17873,17915,17970,18054,18130,18214,18298,18383,18485,18587,18697,18810,18922,19030,19135,19239,19340,19441,19538,19638,19734,19820,19912,19988,20063,20137,20215,20283,20356,20448,20533,20639,20719,20781,20837,20909,20953);

const int WIDTH = 512;
const int HEIGHT = 256;

const vec3 colors[] = vec3[](
vec3(0x10,0x10,0x30),
vec3(0x30,0x30,0x40),
vec3(0x70,0x60,0x60),
vec3(0x70,0x80,0x80),
vec3(0xa0,0xa0,0xa0),
vec3(0xd0,0xc0,0xa0),
vec3(0xe0,0xe0,0xe0),
vec3(0xb0,0x90,0x70),
vec3(0x90,0x70,0x50),
vec3(0x20,0x30,0x20),
vec3(0x30,0x50,0x30),
vec3(0x50,0x50,0x30),
vec3(0xe0,0xd0,0xb0),
vec3(0x30,0x40,0x10),
vec3(0x30,0x50,0x10));

vec3 getcolor(int i) {
  return colors[i%colors.length()]/255.0;
}

void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor, vec2 fragCoord) {
  fragColor = texelFetch(iChannel0,ivec2(fragCoord),0);
  float ires = iResolution.x*10000.0 + iResolution.y;
  if (iFrame != 0 && fragColor.w == ires) return; // Check for resize
  fragColor.w = ires;
  int row = int(fragCoord.y); // Desired row
  row = min(row,HEIGHT-1); // Clamp at edges
  int col = int(fragCoord.x); // Desired column
  col = min(col,WIDTH-1); // Clamp at edges
  // Find the index of the start of the row
  int rstart = rowindex[row];
  // And of the next row
  int rend = rowindex[row+1];
  int c = -1;
  int colcount = 0; // column count
  for (int index = rstart; index < rend; index++) {
    int i = index;
    uvec4 entry = data[i/16];
    i %= 16;
    uint t = entry[i/4];
    i %= 4;
    t >>= 8*i;
    int count = (int(t >> 4)&15)+1;
    colcount += count;
    if (col < colcount) {
      c = int(t)&15; // Found it!
      break;
    }
  }
  if (c < 0) fragColor.rgb = vec3(1,0,0); // Shouldn't happen
  else fragColor.rgb = getcolor(c);
}

atmosphere is like water in a pan:

This transfer to the air above, which temperature diffuse slowly upwise.
But diffusion delay vs day alternance creates a temporary roof for clouds: the thermal inversion

name: Cherry Blossom
author: chenglou
description: Random experiment with polar coordinates and short code. Stare long enough and even static objects start rotating afterward
image_code:
void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord) {
    vec2 uv = (2. * fragCoord - iResolution.xy) / iResolution.y; // normalize y from -1 to 1
    float r = length(uv); // radius
    float a = atan(uv.y, uv.x); // angle
    
    float color = cos(6. * (a + iTime / 2.)) - sin(iTime) / 2. + .5 - tan(r * sin((sin(iTime) * 2. + 12.) * r)); // numbers here mostly arbitrary

    fragColor = vec4(color * (vec4(r, 0.3/r, r/1.2, 1))); // arbitrary constant numbers here too
}

contrary to marching-cube, for marching triangles we must rely on less well-defined image smoothing to fit the sampling rate at vertices.
